Trial_Design.evidence: patients undergoing elective hepatectomy under general anesthesia combined with thoracic epidural anesthesia were enrolled and randomly allocated

Participants.evidence: patients undergoing elective hepatectomy under general anesthesia combined with thoracic epidural anesthesia

Intervention.evidence: randomly allocated to either group R (remimazolam anesthesia) or group P (propofol anesthesia)

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized that remimazolam-based anesthesia would improve hemodynamic instability compared to propofol-based anesthesia.

Method_Outcome.evidence: hemodynamic instability was evaluated by the hemodynamic instability scores (HI-score)

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomly allocated to either group R (remimazolam anesthesia) or group P (propofol anesthesia)

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 72 subjects were randomized

Number_Analysed.evidence: 33 ones under minor hepatectomy surgery in each group were analyzed finally

Result_Outcome.evidence: the total HI-score was significantly lower in group R (22.8 ± 2.1) than group P (33.0 ± 4.1, P = 0.029)

Harms.evidence: remimazolam-based anesthesia did not reduce incidence of major cardiovascular events
